Table  1.Optimization of reaction conditions.[a] [a] Standard conditions: graphite rod electrode (anode) (Φ=6 mm), platinum plate electrode (cathode) (1.0 cm ×1.0 cm ×0.3 mm),1 a(0.3 mmol, 1.0 equiv.),2 a(0.75 mmol, 2.5 equiv.), MeCN (5.0 mL), H2O (0.4 mL),nBu4NBF4(0.5 mmol), constant current of 9 mA, undivided cell, rt, 6 h. [b] Percent yield determined by1H NMR integration of unpurified reaction mixture versus triphenylmethane as internal standard.
Scheme 1CaptionSynthesis ofβ-keto sulfones from unsaturated compounds and sulfonyl radicals.

Scheme 2CaptionScope of alkynes1. Reaction conditions: undivided cell, graphite rod electrode (anode) (Φ=6 mm), platinum plate electrode (cathode) (1.0 cm×1.0 cm×0.3 mm), constant current=9 mA,1(0.3 mmol),2 a(0.75 mmol, 2.5 equiv.),nBu4NBF4(0.5 mmol), MeCN (5.0 mL), H2O (0.4 mL), rt, 6 h. Yields are reported for isolated products after purification. Faradaic efficiency of reaction of substrates measured under constant current conditions. [a] The reaction was extended to 8 h.

Scheme 3CaptionScope of sulfonyl hydrazides2. Reaction conditions: undivided cell, graphite rod electrode (anode) (Φ=6 mm), platinum plate electrode (cathode) (1.0 cm×1.0 cm×0.3 mm), constant current=9 mA,1 a(0.3 mmol),2(0.75 mmol, 2.5 equiv.),nBu4NBF4(0.5 mmol), MeCN (5.0 mL), H2O (0.4 mL), rt, 6 h. Yields are reported for isolated products after purification. Faradaic efficiency of reaction of substrates measured under constant current conditions. [a] The reaction was extended to 8 h.
